Package ui

Class SystemGreen

java.lang.Object
ui.SystemGreen
public class SystemGreen extends Object
The SystemGreen class is the main class for the GreenSQA data system. This class provides a menu to perform various operations related to project management.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • SystemGreen

      public SystemGreen()
      Constructor for the SystemGreen class. Initializes the Scanner object and ControllerProjects object.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws ParseException
      The main method for the SystemGreen class. Initializes a SystemGreen object and calls the menu method.
      Parameters:
      args - The command line arguments passed to the program.
      Throws:
      ParseException - If there is an error parsing the user input for dates.

    • menu

      public void menu() throws ParseException
      The menu method provides a menu of options for the user to choose from. The user's selection determines which project management operation is performed.
      Throws:
      ParseException - If there is an error parsing the user input for dates.

    • initProject

      public void initProject() throws ParseException
      Initializes the project by asking for information such as project name, start and end dates, budget, names and phone numbers of GreenSQA and company managers, and the duration of each project stage in months.
      Throws:
      ParseException - If there is an error in parsing the date inputs.

    • registerCapsule

      public void registerCapsule()
      Prompts the user to enter information about a new capsule and registers it in the system.

    • culminateStage

      public void culminateStage() throws ParseException
      Method to culminate a stage of a project. It prompts the user for the project number and the start date of the new stage, then calls the controller's culminateStage method to perform the action. It also displays information about the created stage and its expected end date.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if there is an error parsing the input date

    • approveCapsule

      public void approveCapsule()
      Approves a capsule in a specific project stage, setting its approval status to true and recording the approval date.

    • publishCapsule

      public void publishCapsule()
      Publishes a capsule in a specific stage of a project. Prompts the user to enter the project number, the stage (0 to 5), and the capsule number. If the capsule has been approved for publishing, prints the URL for the HTML page and sets the "publishCapsule" flag to true. If the capsule has not been approved for publishing, prints a message indicating that it cannot be published.

    • informCapsuleType

      public void informCapsuleType()
      Prints the number of capsules for each type (technical, management, domain, experience) in a given project.

    • informLessonsForStage

      public void informLessonsForStage()
      This method prompts the user to enter a project and a stage, and then prints out the lessons for each capsule in that stage if they exist.

    • projectNameMostCapsule

      public void projectNameMostCapsule()
      This method determines which project has the most capsules and prints out that project's name and the number of capsules it has.

    • checkCapsulesSomeone

      public void checkCapsulesSomeone()
      This method prompts the user to enter a name and then checks all capsules to see if that person has created a capsule. If so, it prints out the project, stage, and capsule number for each capsule created by that person.

    • searchLessonsAndSituationsCapsules

      public void searchLessonsAndSituationsCapsules()
      This method prompts the user to enter a hashtag and searches all capsules for matches. If a match is found, it prints out the lesson and situation for the capsule, but only if the capsule has been approved and published. If the capsule has not been published, it prints out a message indicating that there is a match but the capsule has not been published.
